title: Oshosondy
author: Oshosondy
content: I thought I have unsubscribed Yobit finally not to receive any email from the exchange again but probably I did not until I see this email message today. I do not know about any bitcoin fork but Yobit posted about bitcoin fork. This is not bitcoin fork but just a scam shit coin that will drain your money. This is not bitcoin fork, it is Yobit shit coin scam. If there is any true bitcoin fork coin, we would have known about it early enough before the fork. No bitcoin fork but a way Yobit is advertising another scam shit coin.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: I think they probably make a new token every week at this point. They were busy trying to jump on the ico hype before, I guess they're just trying to find newer ways to do what they normally do.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Yobit is a scam and whoever advertises it is a douche.  Nothing can change my mind about this one.They have been creating inexistent coins for years now.  I wonder why and how the hell are they even still in existence with such a well known history of scams and inexistent coins sold for expensive prices.-Regards,PrivacyG

comments.author: Doell
comments.body: I also received that mail, but didn't see it and go to yobit. The reason not exchanging any coins in a long time at also there. You're right it might just be tokens or something else, as usual. Investing in new coins at there is very risky, it is not recommended. Notably, with little knowledge, the brand is same but this coins are different.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: People who know Yobit exchange very well will not try even to register on that platform.It's commonly known as a house of shitcoins and other hype coins that going to exit scam.  There are a lot of coins there that have a shady behavior like pump and dump coins, so I think there's no point in trusting them.Anyway, all Bitcoin fork has been proven they are all scam even though which exchange it is listed maybe it is good if we stay away on this.

comments.author: Rabi3
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on May 23, 2022, 06:41:33 PMI thought I have unsubscribed Yobit finally not to receive any email from the exchange again but probably I did not until I see this email message today. I do not know about any bitcoin fork but Yobit posted about bitcoin fork. This is not bitcoin fork but just a scam shit coin that will drain your money. This is not bitcoin fork, it is Yobit shit coin scam. If there is any true bitcoin fork coin, we would have known about it early enough before the fork. No bitcoin fork but a way Yobit is advertising another scam shit coin.I hope people understand by now that Yobit is constantly promoting and creating scam tokens, i see reports all over the internet about such shit coins that they keep creating, without forgetting about the high fees that they have compared to other big exchanges, I recommend people to stay away from it, there are better options.

comments.author: JeffBrad12
comments.body: Any fork that will always be created by yobit was scam, this exchange site was always using this old trick since this exchange site was exist. This shitty exchange site will always be repeating to create more and more fork once the old fork dead or has no demand. Yobit is always using this trick to fool its own traders and users. How stupid the people who are still using this garbage exchange site. Just marked this as an exchange site that must be included in your ignore list. This exchange site is nothing rather than bunch of scam tokens.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: Nothing new about this news since they always create new tokens for them to gain and I don't think their exchange is profitable for them anymore that's why they do this to scam their users and thinking that there's something huge will be listed on their exchange. New traders should avoid this exchange because this is old scam which is been rugged by so many times and also for sure they will never be a good exchange because they didn't perform very well in many years on their existence.

comments.author: kurniawan05
comments.body: I doubt if the news about the bitcoin fork is true, if the news is true then it must have been reported by trusted websites and become a hot topic in various groups, in fact we have not found any news about the bitcoin fork.

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: Often at certain time interval new tokens roll out of the platform. One could've never heard of such tokens. Atleast with this people are familiar about the name. It also lists more number of tokens to the exchange, which is the reason why it has been getting used. The exchange is something different from the other exchanges, have everything in a single platform. Bitcoin fork is one more addition to the new tokens launched in recent days. In the past I used to use yobit to play Dice with available tokens.

comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: This exchange site is a scam token generator. The bitcoin fork that announced by yobit was a token that issued by yobit itself. This exchange site is always issuing scam token anytime with different name and gave different label to the new token that will be issued as well. I remember when yobit was even issuing so many fake stable dollar that has no value right now. Any announcement that came from the yobit exchange site will always be related with the scam token. keep in your mind if yobit was a scam exchange site

comments.author: Kunnu
comments.body: Those people who are in crypto industry from the last four or five years knows very well that what kind of shit attempts this exchange does from time to time to scam people and now this is another legerdemain of this exchange in the name of Bitcoin fork this is absolutely ridiculous I would strongly recommend to new people stay away from this crap.

comments.author: killerjoegreece
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on May 23, 2022, 10:56:40 PMPeople who know Yobit exchange very well will not try even to register on that platform.It's commonly known as a house of shitcoins and other hype coins that going to exit scam.  There are a lot of coins there that have a shady behavior like pump and dump coins, so I think there's no point in trusting them.Anyway, all Bitcoin fork has been proven they are all scam even though which exchange it is listed maybe it is good if we stay away on this. Agreed 100% on that assesement. The old timers remember what a bad exchange yobit is.

comments.author: Widdop37
comments.body: Strange   A BTC fork should be well recognised and known about around the crypto space just like BCH and other forks but with Yobit exchange they are just doing as they like, this isn't a genuine fork they are trying to deceive their customers once again, it's nothing new.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: jackg on May 23, 2022, 07:00:05 PMI think they probably make a new token every week at this point. They were busy trying to jump on the ico hype before, I guess they're just trying to find newer ways to do what they normally do. Very possible, though I do not get their mail until this fake bitcoin fork which is not any fork because bitcoin blockchain is not splitting.Quote from: PrivacyG on May 23, 2022, 09:35:58 PMYobit is a scam and whoever advertises it is a douche.  Nothing can change my mind about this one.They have been creating inexistent coins for years now.  I wonder why and how the hell are they even still in existence with such a well known history of scams and inexistent coins sold for expensive prices.I can say that too, so many of their coin, especially their coins created like this that is only tradable on their exchange and no where else. Not listed on Coinmarketcap or any other related site like Coingecko. It is an exchange to avoid.Good to stay away from this exchange which is very shady to avoid scam.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: their model of fraud is constantly based on the same approach. when presenting every new garbage from their kitchen, they use the most popular phrases to attract naive people. Fork, swap, stake, dollar etc...I remember their airdrop where they promised a free 700 dollars, it was actually some worthless garbage they called a dollar.I'm still surprised how they still survive, who pays them money after all and why they are still not sanctioned by the authorities.

comments.author: inanilujimi
comments.body: Seeing this, I remembered that my yobit account was no longer accessible because I couldn't verify the google authenticator, when in fact I never used it and when I asked for support from them my account was suddenly suspended and could no longer be opened.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on May 23, 2022, 10:56:40 PMPeople who know Yobit exchange very well will not try even to register on that platform.It's commonly known as a house of shitcoins and other hype coins that going to exit scam.  There are a lot of coins there that have a shady behavior like pump and dump coins, so I think there's no point in trusting them.Anyway, all Bitcoin fork has been proven they are all scam even though which exchange it is listed maybe it is good if we stay away on this. This Yobit in-house shitcoins are even worse than regular scammers who create useless coins and tokens and promote them on social media and forums. Regular shitcoins at least have a blockchain, unlike this Yobit scam tokens. I saw recently that they were promoting the Luna fork, and now they have decided to try the same thing with Bitcoin. They employ the same strategy over and over again. Apparently they are running out of ways to lure new victims into their scam. They even offer a bonus for new registrations of 4700 FUSD (Fast Dollars), but they were actually supposed to say Fake Dollars because this is just another worthless in-hosue token!

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Looks like they ran out of idea how to earn money scam people, so they decided to re-invent old wheel. AFAIK yobit frequently send email, so clearly they don't respect the fact you already unsubscribed if you haven't receive any email from them in long time. I would recommend you to find option "Report Spam".Quote from: Widdop37 on May 24, 2022, 07:14:11 AMStrange   A BTC fork should be well recognised and known about around the crypto space just like BCH and other forks but with Yobit exchange they are just doing as they like, this isn't a genuine fork they are trying to deceive their customers once again, it's nothing new.While it's not genuine fork, most BTC fork isn't recognized even by BTC holder. Website such as https://findmycoins.ninja lists some which have some value, but it's likely you only heard 2-5 of them.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on May 24, 2022, 12:12:15 PMLooks like they ran out of idea how to earn money scam people, so they decided to re-invent old wheel. AFAIK yobit frequently send email, so clearly they don't respect the fact you already unsubscribed if you haven't receive any email from them in long time. I would recommend you to find option "Report Spam".Maybe we can say that they are run out of enough money to use to promote their scam site that's why they are just relying on email blasting and try to make their registered users believe that there are new coins or even tokens listen which have potential on their site and this they do this multiple times so to avoid getting those email better report or mute them to avoid any disturbance again on our personal mails.
